thread.title: Delaware North to sell Lizard Island in Great Barrier Reef
thread.title_full: Delaware North to sell Lizard Island in Great Barrier Reef | afr.com

author: Matthew Cranston
title: Delaware North to sell Lizard Island in Great Barrier Reef
text:
Delaware's Lizard Island in the Great Barrier Reef. supplied Share on twitter Share on Google Plus by Matthew Cranston United States-based hospitality group Delaware North has offered Lizard Island Resort and Heron Island Resort in Queensland's Great Barrier Reef for sale.
Delaware purchased the two luxury islands in 2009 alongside Wilson Island in Queensland – El Questro​ Wilderness Park in the Kimberley region of Western Australia and Kings Canyon Resort in the Northern Territory. The price was not disclosed but it was part of a broader portfolio sold off by GPT Group for $85 million representing a 40 per cent discount to the values held the year before.
Delaware has spent about $50 million on the award-winning Lizard Island Resort with a comprehensive redevelopment program, including the upgrade of all 40 rooms and suites. The Resort is accessed via a flight from Cairns connecting 30 domestic and 18 international destinations.
JLL Hotels and Hospitality Group's managing director for investment sales Mark Durran and vice-president for investment sales Andrew Langsford​ have been appointed to sell the assets.
"The Great Barrier Reef is the subject of renewed international investor interest due to strong trading results over the past 12 months and an excellent outlook as a result of numerous positive market influences," said Mr Langsford.
Delaware North, which turns over $US2.9 billion ($4.2 billion) a year, is a private company, controlled by the Jacobs family for almost 100 years, and a successful manager of resorts in places such as Yosemite National Park and the Grand Canyon.
